dct:description: Location of US Routes in the state of Florida as derived from even mapping
prov:action:
#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/fl_us_highways/{download,etl} && cd /data/fl_us_highways

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  wget -O download/fl_us_highways.json 'https://services1.arcgis.com/O1JpcwDW8sjYuddV/arcgis/rest/services/US_Routes_TDA/FeatureServer/0/query?where=1%3D1&outFields=*&outSR=4326&f=json'

# replace column names Shape__Length and Shape__Area to avoid conflict when
# providing as service on ArcServer.
sed -i 's/Shape__Length/shape_length/gI; s/Shape__Area/shape_area/gI' download/fl_us_highways.json

# load into postGIS with:
  ogr2ogr -lco GEOMETRY_NAME=geom -f PostgreSQL PG:"<postgres connection>" download/fl_us_highways.json -nlt multilinestring -nln fl_us_highways

#########
# Step 2 - SQL script (pseudo code):
####

# remove duplicate points and make geometries valid:
UPDATE fl_us_highways
  SET geom=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(geom));"

# add local geometry column and reproject existing geometries into local EPSG:
SELECT AddGeometryColumn (
  'fl_us_highways',
  'geom_local',2236,'multilinestring',2
);
UPDATE fl_us_highways
  SET geom_local=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(ST_Transform(ST_Multi(geom),2236)));
CREATE INDEX fl_us_highways_geom_local_idx
  ON fl_us_highways
  USING GIST (geom_local);
NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';"cd /data/fl_us_highways/
mkdir -p derived
# Create pg_dump and downloadable zip of table in derivate directory 
pg_dump -d $POSTGRES_DB -U $POSTGRES_USER -p $POSTGRES_PORT -h postgis-i0s0kjcd4vm8nk3a -t fl_us_highways > derived/fl_us_highways.sql
tar -czf derived/fl_us_highways.sql.tar.gz meta_dcat_fl_us_highways.json -C derived fl_us_highways.sql
dcat:contactPoint: University of Miami Libraries, Frost Institute for Data Science and Computing
gdsc:label: route
gdsc:attributes: fid;Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated;ESRI;oid;

roadway;A  unique 8-character identification number assigned to a roadway or section of a roadway either On or Off the State Highway System for which information is maintained in the Department's Roadway Characteristics Inventory (RCI);Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;string;

rank;Indicates this county road segment's rank. A rank of 1 means that the segment is primary, a rank of 2 means that it is secondary. This ranking is pertinent where two county road designations overlap the same roadway.;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;string;
route;US route number;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data &Analytics Office;string;
routenum;US route number (number only;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;string;
district;FDOT District Number;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;string;

countydot;Two-character Florida Department of Transportation county identifier.  The ROADWAY identifier's first 2 characters are the county identifier.;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;string;
county;The county that contains the roadway;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;string;

mng_dist;The District that manages the roadway (District 1, District 2, District 3, District 4, District 5, District 6, District 7, or Turnpike). Note that the Managing District may not be the same as the geographic district.  For example, roadway ID 08470001 is managed by Turnpike, but its geographic District is District 7. This is a 2-character representation of the Managing District.;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;string;
begin_post;Denotes the lowest milepoint for the record;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;double;
end_post;Denotes the highest milepoint for the record;Florida Department of Transportation, Transportation Data & Analytics Office;double;
shape_leng;Length in meters of the geometry for the record;ESRI;double;
